sentences.english: After years of collecting, he has stored up lots of rare treasures.
sentences.chinese: 經過多年的收集，他已經祕藏了很多稀世的珍寶。

sentences.english: I can see that you're only interested in the exceptionally rare ones.
sentences.chinese: 可以看出你只對那些稀世珍寶感興趣。

sentences.english: Silk tapestry, top grade gift, rare collection.
sentences.chinese: 真絲掛毯，高檔禮品，稀世藏品。

sentences.english: There is no rare treasure here.
A cat-o'-nine tails is displayed in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 博物館展出一件稀世珍寶。

sentences.english: It is famous the world, is also our unique rare treasures of the Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 它名揚世界，也是我們中華民族獨有稀世珍寶。

sentences.english: Writing brushes made in Ming and Qing Dynasties are precious nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 明清時的毛筆，已是稀世珍寶了。

sentences.english: In central city and the art galleries with various valuable rarities .
sentences.chinese: 心漂亮的雕塑，還有滿是稀世珍寶的藝術展覽館。

sentences.english: Though an earthen vessel, it held so great a treasure .
sentences.chinese: 只是一隻泥土器皿，但裏面裝的卻是一件稀世奇珍。

sentences.english: How has time, how has man, served these marvels?
sentences.chinese: 時光流逝，人事更替，這些稀世之寶終於成了什麼呢？

sentences.english: What rare treasures does it have?
sentences.chinese: 這島上有什麼稀世珍寶嗎？

sentences.english: The collector knew that he had latched onto a rare antique.
sentences.chinese: 收藏家知道他得到了一件稀世古董。

sentences.english: Central city and the art galleries with various valuable rarities.
sentences.chinese: 心漂亮的雕塑，還有滿是稀世珍寶的藝術展覽館。

definition: a rare treasure/sth priceless and unique
best quality/item of the highest quality/(slang) outrageous/annoying in the extreme/gross/person with these qualities
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
